block.p: EBAY, San Jose, Calif., an online auctioneer, is cutting back its live auction businesses in a move that will result in 13 layoffs of the 21 employees in the Chicago office of its subsidiary Butterfield & Butterfield.
L-3 COMMUNICATIONS HOLDINGS, New York, a maker of flight-data recorders and military communications systems, agreed to buy 54 percent of LogiMetrics Inc., Bohemia, N.Y., for about $15 million.

VF WORKWEAR, Nashville, a manufacturer of uniforms, will shut down a shirt plant in Dickson, Tenn., in mid-September, idling about 260 workers, making it the third Tennessee factory closing this year.
NATURAL MICROSYSTEMS, Framingham, Mass., which supplies network-quality hardware and software, said it planned to split its stock two shares for one on Aug. 7 to shareholders of record on July 24.
